name: Get Last Agent Who Handled a Voice Interaction by Phone Number - Exported 2025-07-25 @ 09-28

successSchema.title: List of last userIds / conversationIds ordered conversationStart desc

errorSchema.title: ErrorBody
errorSchema.description: Detailed information about an error response.

errorCode.description: A code unique to this error.

status.description: The HTTP status code for this message (400, 401, 403, 404, 500, etc.)

correlationId.description: The correlation Id or context Id for this message. If left blank the Public API will look at the HTTP response header 'ININ-Correlation-Id' instead.

entityId.description: The ID of the entity this error refers to. Only used in BackendErrorBody instances within the errors array.

entityName.description: The name of the entity this error refers to. Only used in BackendErrorBody instances within the errors array.

userMessage.description: A customer friendly message. This should be a complete sentence, use proper grammar and only include information useful to a customer. This is not a dev message and should not include things like Org Id

userParamsMessage.description: This is the same as message except it uses template fields for variable replacement. For instance: 'User {username} was not found'

userParams.description: Used in conjunction with userParamsMessage. These are the template parameters. For instance: UserParam.key = 'username', UserParam.value = 'john.doe'

inputSchema.title: Query for last  inbound/outbound voice conversation related to a phone number.
inputSchema.description: Fields needed in the body of the POST to create a query.

Interval.description: Specifies the date and time range of data being queried. Results will include conversations that both started on a day touched by the interval AND either started, ended, or any activity during the interval. Intervals are represented as an ISO-8601 string. For example: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss/YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss
